label: QuantityElement
comment: The quantity elment is used to define the quantities (eg 100), units of measure (eg Kg) and product class (eg GTIN or other class identifier) of products that are inputs or outputs or the subject of supply chain events.

datatypeProperties.comment: THe identifier of a product class (as opposed to a product instance) such as a GTIN code for a manufactured product.
The numeric quantity of the product class (eg 100 kg of cotton)
The unit of measure for the quantity value (eg Kg or meters etc) using the UNECE Rec 20 unit of measure codelist.

referencedBy.comment: List of quantified product classes that have been aggregated into the parent.  Used whwn the child items do not have unique identifiers (eg 100 Kg of cotton bales)

The quantified list of product classes that are the input of this transformation event - usend when each item does not have a unique identity.  for example the weight of raw cotton that is the input to a ginning process.

The quantified list of product classes that are the output of this transformation event - usend when each item does not have a unique identity.  for example a count of the bales of cleaned cotton that are the output of a ginning process.
A quantified list of product classes (eg GS1 GTINs) that are the focus of this object event
